content.description: At the instant shown, three identical asteroids are in a line. Asteroid <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mtext>B</mtext> </mstyle> </math> is equidistant from asteroids <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>A</mtext></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mtext>C</mtext> </mstyle> </math>, as shown. The asteroids are in empty space such that the only forces on each asteroid are the forces from the other two. The positive <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-direction is defined to be to the right.
content.question: Which of the following correctly ranks the magnitudes of the net forces exerted on asteroids <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mtext>A</mtext> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, <math alttext="F sub A comma net, end sub" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>A</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="F sub B comma net, end sub" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>B</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> respectively, and provides correct reasoning?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub A comma net, end sub, equals F sub B comma net, end sub" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>A</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>B</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. The forces are a Newtonâ€™s third law pair.

<math alttext="F sub A comma net, end sub, equals F sub B comma net, end sub" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>A</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>B</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. The net force on both asteroids is zero.

<math alttext="F sub A comma net, end sub, is greater than F sub B comma net, end sub" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>A</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>B</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. The net force on Asteroid <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is zero.

<math alttext="F sub A comma net, end sub, is greater than F sub B comma net, end sub" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>A</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>B</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. The forces on Asteroid <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>A</mtext></mstyle></math> are exerted in opposite directions.

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub A comma net, end sub, is greater than F sub B comma net, end sub" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>A</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>B</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>net</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. The net force on Asteroid <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is zero.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
